source_sentence: 堅固交遘而不休息，感應圓成，名精行仙；
translation: The sage who is steadfast, engaged in debate without ceasing, and completely enlightened. He is called the spirit of zealous practice.

source_sentence: 堅固變化而不休息，覺悟圓成，名絕行仙。
translation: Being resolute in his transformations without resting, he's perfectly enlightened and accomplished, and he's called the immortal who stops practicing.

source_sentence: 是等皆於人中鍊心，不循正覺，別得生理壽千萬歲，休止深山或大海島絕於人境，
translation: They all cultivate their minds among humans and don’t follow right awakening. They attain separate physical life spans of a thousand years, so that they may live in the deep mountains or ocean islands without human beings.

source_sentence: 斯亦輪迴妄想流轉，不修三昧，報盡還來散入諸趣。
translation: They also transmigrate in the stream of deluded thoughts, don't cultivate samādhi, return when their retribution is exhausted, and disperse into the destinies.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 諸世間人不求常住，未能捨諸妻妾恩愛，於邪婬中心不流逸澄瑩生明，
translation: The people of the world don't seek permanence, aren't able to abandon their wives and concubines' kindnesses, and don't practice sexual misconduct in the midst of sexual misconduct that produces clarity and insight.

source_sentence: 命終之後隣於日月，如是一類名四天王天；
translation: At the end of their lifetimes, they will be next to the sun and moon. These beings are thus called the four guardian gods of heaven.

source_sentence: 於己妻房婬愛微薄，於淨居時不得全味，命終之後超日月明居人間頂，
translation: Their love for their own wife's room is weak, and they can't get the full flavor when they live in a pure place. After their life ends, they transcend the sun and moon and live at the top of the human world.

source_sentence: 如是一類名忉利天；
translation: In this way one kind is called the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

source_sentence: 逢欲暫交去無思憶，於人間世動少靜多，命終之後於虛空中朗然安住，
translation: When he was about to leave the world for a short time, he had no ideation of it. The human world moved slowly and quietly, but when his life came to an end he remained in space, shining peacefully.

source_sentence: 日月光明上照不及，是諸人等自有光明，如是一類名須焰摩天；
translation: The light of the sun and moon is not as bright as that which shines above. These beings themselves have their own light. Such a group is called the Sudarśana gods.

source_sentence: 一切時靜，有應觸來未能違戾，命終之後上昇精微，不接下界諸人天境，
translation: At all times it is still, and there are those who should be touched but cannot disobey it. When their life ends they rise up in the realm of sentient beings and gods; not humans or goddesses in the lower realms.

source_sentence: 乃至劫壞三災不及，如是一類名兜率陀天；
translation: As long as the world age of destruction and the three calamities do not come up, such a class is called the Tushita heaven.

source_sentence: 我無欲心應汝行事，於橫陳時味如嚼蠟，命終之後生越化地，如是一類名樂變化天；
translation: You should act according to my mind free from desire. When I manifest it, its taste is like that of chewing on the scented milk. After death, I will be reborn in the transfiguration realm. Such a being is called the Nirmāṇarati

source_sentence: 無世間心同世行事，於行事交了然超越，命終之後遍能出超化無化境，
translation: The absence of worldly awarenesses is the same as worldly action. They are simultaneous and transcend one another in terms of action. After death, they can go beyond all realms of apparitional beings and nonapparitional beings.

source_sentence: 如是一類名他化自在天。
translation: Thus, this one type is called the Paranirmita-vaśavartin Heaven.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是六天，形雖出動心跡尚交，自此已還名為欲界。
translation: Thus these six celestials, even though their forms emerge and move, still share the same mental traces, and after that they're called the desire realm again.
